newsitem.title: JAPAN: TOCOM sees rising liquidity in aluminium futures.
newsitem.headline: TOCOM sees rising liquidity in aluminium futures.

text.p: The Tokyo Commodity Exchange (TOCOM) said on Thursday that the liquidity of its aluminium futures will grow as new contract months are listed later this year, despite lower-than-expected volume at present.
TOCOM launched a yen-based aluminium futures contract on April 7, but average daily volume so far, at 5,742 lots, is well below the 20,000 lots the exchange originally expected.
"All months will be listed by next February. We expect more orders from participants by then," said Kazunari Hayakawa, general manager of TOCOM's trading management section.
Hayakawa said TOCOM expects open interest to increase to about 100,000 lots by February 1998, against 20,123 lots as of April 23.
"When we launched a yen-based gold futures contract in 1982, volume and liquidity were quite low for a while. We'd like to achieve slow but steady growth for the aluminium contract," Hayakawa said.
